divs: Sighting DetailsEvery night I take my dog outside and give him a cookie when "he goes to bed." Every night for the past several years, I have looked up to the sky, wondering if anything were looking back at me. Tonight I was walking on the patio, under the patio "roof." I came over to the fence and instantly looked up to the sky. I noticed this BRIGHT blue-white light south east of the house. I thought to myself that it was possibly the star Sirius, but dismissed that thought quickly because Sirius is not in the south east right now. I kept my eyes GLUED on the light. It was heading east south east - in the direction of Wichita Falls. I then noticed that the light began to fade. I instantly went over several things in my mind. Was it an airplane? NO. There were no strobing lights, and it was one solid light. Was it a satalite? No. Satalites are nowhere near that bright, and do not move that slowly. Was it a planet? No. The only planet that bright is Venus, and it is not visible this time of day, this time of year. After watching it for about a minute, the light faded away and there were no signs of anything ever being there. I stood in disbelief for several minutes, but I never saw it again. I did however see two airplanes. They seemed to be comercial aircraft. However, there is an Air Force bace in the area. Nevertheless, they did not look similar to what I saw.
trends: There have been 2 other sightings in Electra
There were no other sightings in Electra on or around June 8th 2008
